cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba and 105 mi S of Long Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas then turning north-northwest, skirting the east coast of Florida before moving toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible coastal encounter along the east coast of Florida near North Palm Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach; Hurricane Watch also for Camaguey, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Cuban provinces Guantanamo through Las Tunas, all Bahamas, and Florida east coast from North Palm Beach to Flagler/Volusia county line; Tropical Storm Warning Chokoloskee to Golden Beach, Florida Keys east of Seven-Mile Bridge, and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas and the entire east coast of Florida northward to Georgia/South Carolina, with indirect impacts across the Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: There is up to a 46% chance that Port Manatee experiences sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34–45 kt) beginning late Thursday night through Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Gulf coast; surge threat is confined to Florida’s Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands (1–3 inches) possible as Matthew’s outer rain-shield crosses the peninsula.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional squalls and choppy seas in Tampa Bay could disrupt cargo handling; heightened Port Condition preparedness levels may be required even without direct landfall.
